snippet: Once enrolled in Medicare, H.S.A. holders cannot make new contributions to the savings plan. Careful planning is needed to maximize the savings.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Matters column says special rules apply to older people who contribute to tax-favored health savings accounts as they near age 65 and become eligible for federal Medicare coverage; questions and answers on health savings accounts given.
lead_paragraph: Once enrolled in Medicare, H.S.A. holders cannot make new contributions to the savings plan. Careful planning is needed to maximize the savings.
